direction: Directions to SolveRead each definition and all four choices carefully, and find the answer that provides the best example of the given definition.
question: AGuaranteeis a promise or assurance that attests to the quality of a product that is either (1) given in writing by the manufacturer or (2) given verbally by the person selling the product. Which situation below is the best example of a Guarantee?

options.A: Melissa purchases a DVD player with the highest consumer ratings in its category.
options.B: The salesperson advises Curt to be sure that he buys an air conditioner with a guarantee.
options.C: The local auto body shop specializes in refurbishing and selling used cars.
options.D: Lori buys a used digital camera from her coworker who says that she will refund Lori's money if the camera's performance is not of the highest quality.

answer_description: Choices a, b, and c do not describe situations in which a product is guaranteed. Only choice d reflects a situation in which a seller attests to the quality of a product by giving the buyer a promise or assurance about its quality.

direction: Directions to SolveRead each definition and all four choices carefully, and find the answer that provides the best example of the given definition.
question: The rules of baseball state that a batterLegally Completes His Time at Batwhen he is put out or becomes a base runner. Which situation below is the best example of a batter Legally Completing His Time at Bat?

options.A: Jared's blooper over the head of the short-stop puts him in scoring position.
options.B: The umpire calls a strike, even though the last pitch was way outside.
options.C: The pitcher throws his famous knuckleball, Joe swings and misses, and the umpire calls a strike.
options.D: The count is two balls and two strikes as Mario waits for the next pitch.

answer_description: The fact that Jared is in scoring position due to his  blooper indicates that he has hit the ball and is now a base runner; therefore, he has legally completed his time at bat. Choices b and c both describe situations in which a strike is called, but they do not state that the batter has been put out or that he is now a base runner. Choice d describes a situation in which the batter, Mario, is still at the plate waiting for the  next pitch.

direction: Directions to SolveRead each definition and all four choices carefully, and find the answer that provides the best example of the given definition.
question: Erratic Behavioroccurs when an individual acts in a manner that lacks consistency, regularity, and uniformity. Which situation below is the best example of Erratic Behavior?

options.A: Julia cannot contain her anger whenever the subject of local politics is discussed.
options.B: Martin has just been told that he is being laid off. Before leaving his supervisor's office, he punches a hole in the door.
options.C: Rhonda has visited the dealership several times, but she still cannot decide which car to buy.
options.D: In the past month, Jeffrey, who has been a model employee for three years, has repeatedly called in sick, forgotten important meetings, and been verbally abusive to colleagues.

answer_description: Jeffrey's recent behavior is clearly inconsistent and irregular.

direction: Directions to SolveRead each definition and all four choices carefully, and find the answer that provides the best example of the given definition.
question: ATiebreakeris an additional contest or period of play designed to establish a winner among tied contestants. Which situation below is the best example of a Tiebreaker?

options.A: At halftime, the score is tied at 28.
options.B: Mary and Megan have each scored three goals in the game.
options.C: The referee tosses a coin to decide which team will have possession of the ball first.
options.D: The Sharks and the Bears each finished with 14 points, and they are now battling it out in a five-minute overtime.

answer_description: This is the only choice that indicates that an additional period of play is taking place to determine the winner of a game that ended in a tie.

direction: Directions to SolveRead each definition and all four choices carefully, and find the answer that provides the best example of the given definition.
question: In the Maple Hill school district, aFive-Day Suspensionoccurs when a student is not permitted to attend school for five days for  (1) physically assaulting another student, a teacher, or a school employee or (2) willfully destructing or defacing school property. Which situation below is the best example of a Five-Day Suspension?

options.A: Lillian gets caught cheating on a math test for the second time and is suspended from school.
options.B: Marc is asked to leave the classroom due to his constant disruptions.
options.C: Franny uses spray paint to write derogatory comments on the locker room wall and she is given a suspension.
options.D: Ms. Farmer tells her class that students who fail the midterm exam will be expected to stay after school for tutoring help.

answer_description: Although choices a and  c both describe suspensions, only choice c describes a suspension that is the result of one of the two scenarios given in the definition of a five-day suspension (physical assault or destructing or defacing school property). Therefore, we can assume that Franny's suspension, which is the result of spray painting school property, will be a five-day suspension. Since  the definition doesn't provide any information about suspensions for cheating, we can assume that Lillian's suspension does not fall into the five-day suspension category.
